intro: Conospermum toddii var. gwynnii, commonly known as Gwynn's conospermum, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and leathery, adapted to reduce water loss in arid conditions. The flowers, which can be pink or red, attract nectar-feeding birds and insects, contributing to its ecological significance.
